data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The Magnemite are united by a magnetism so powerful, it dries all moisture in its vicinity.

data.name: Dark Quilava

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Show the top card of your opponent's deck to all players. If it's a Trainer card, discard it.

attacks.name: Rushing Magma
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If there are fewer than 5 cards in your deck, discard all of them.) This attack does 20 damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: If it turns its back to an opponent, it is a sign that it is getting ready to attack.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

data.name: Regirock

attacks.name: Unyielding Rock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.

data.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Seadra.

data.flavorText: Capable of swimming backward by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail.

data.name: Rhydon

attacks.name: Ram
attacks.text: Rhydon does 20 damage to itself. Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon. Switch the Pokémon even if Rhydon is Knocked Out.)

data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3600 degrees.

data.name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Bad Brawl
attacks.text: If you played Piers from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.flavorText: As halfhearted as this Pokémon's kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr's concrete pillars.

data.name: Tapu Koko

attacks.name: Flying Flip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Poison Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

data.name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

abilities.name: Fast Feet
abilities.text: Dodrio can retreat even when it is Asleep or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Dodrio.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Dodrio can't use Slashing Strike during your next turn.

data.name: Reuniclus

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Telekinesis of Nobility
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.

data.name: Whiscash

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

data.name: Glalie-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ice Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Instant Freeze
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Teleport
attacks.text: Switch Exeggutor with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Jolteon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Panpour
data.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It waters plants with it using its tail.

data.name: Ducklett
data.flavorText: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

data.name: Blastoise-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Splash Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Big Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lateral Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to all of of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Maractus

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pin Missile
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

data.name: Galvantula

attacks.name: Double Thread
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. Also apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Electroweb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

data.name: Articuno ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Synchronized Lift
abilities.text: As long as you have Zapdos ex and Moltres ex in play, the Retreat Cost for Articuno ex is 0.

attacks.name: Ice Gift
attacks.text: You may move a Water Energy attached to Articuno ex to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Freezing Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Mantine

attacks.name: Group Swim
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Aqua Slash
attacks.text: Mantine can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if Remoraid attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Jigglypuff (all if there are less than 3). Jigglypuff is now Asleep.

data.name: Cubchoo

attacks.name: Hail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.

data.name: Jolteon-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Ray
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Frogadier

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

data.name: Furfrou

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

data.name: Croconaw

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

data.name: Slowpoke & Psyduck-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ditch and Splash
attacks.text: Discard any number of Supporter cards from your hand. This attack does 40 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Thrilling Times-GX
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage. If this Pokémon has at least 6 extra Water Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), flip 10 coins instead, and this attack does 100 more damage for each heads. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Aqua Reflect
attacks.text: Move a Water Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The high-pressure water expelled from its tail is so powerful, it can destroy a concrete wall.

data.name: Alomomola
data.flavorText: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Volbeat does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Seadra during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Ditto.

data.name: Nidoran ♂

attacks.name: Come Along
attacks.text: Search your deck for Nidoran ♀ and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to Electrike.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Electrike does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Wynaut

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut) and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.

data.name: Alolan Geodude

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.

data.name: Marowak

attacks.name: Bonemerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bone Impact
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.

data.flavorText: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out messages to others.

data.name: Raikou

attacks.name: Booming Thunder
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

data.name: Dark Jolteon

attacks.name: Lightning Flash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thunder Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Dark Jolteon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A dangerous Pokémon when angered. It likes to playfully shock people with the electricity it stores within its body.

attacks.name: Poison Sting Tackle
attacks.text: Giovanni's Nidorina does 20 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Victory Cup
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Zacian

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Blade
attacks.text: Discard 3 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Luxio. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

data.name: Golem

attacks.name: Stone Edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It tumbles down mountains, leaving grooves from peak to base. Stay clear of these grooves.

data.name: Pelipper

attacks.name: Courier
attacks.text: Put 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your hand.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.

data.name: Manectric

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

data.name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Wartortle during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

data.flavorText: Often hides in water to stalk unweary prey. When swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.

data.name: Regigigas

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: Regigigas can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.

data.flavorText: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Metapod

abilities.name: Green Shield
abilities.text: Each of your Grass Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.flavorText: It prepares for evolution by hardening its shell as much as possible to protect its soft body.

data.name: Wobbuffet

abilities.name: Bide Barricade
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Psychic Pokémon).

attacks.name: Psychic Assault
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to build up its counterstrike.

data.name: Beartic

attacks.name: Powerful Rage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glacier Drop
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.flavorText: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways around the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.

data.name: Wailord

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 40 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

abilities.name: Ice Wall
abilities.text: Any damage done to Glalie by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon with any Special Energy cards attached to it is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heavy Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Team Magma's Secret Base
rules: Whenever any player puts a Basic Pokémon (except for Team Magma Pokémon) from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Trubbish

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.flavorText: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokémon living in your room.

abilities.name: Galactic Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon. Then, put 2 damage counters on Bronzong G. This power can't be used if Bronzong G is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psychic Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Electivire

attacks.name: Tag Team Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to your Magmortar.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

data.name: Farfetch'd

attacks.name: Leek Slap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Farfetch'd stays in play (even putting Farfetch'd on the Bench won't let you use it again).

data.flavorText: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. This sprig is used much like a metal sword.

data.name: Whiscash

ancientTrait.name: α Growth
ancientTrait.text: When you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon (except with an attack, Ability, or Trainer card), you may attach 2 Energy cards.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.

data.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Electrichain
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage if you have any Lightning Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

attacks.name: Rock Hurl
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Blacephalon

attacks.name: Blazer
attacks.text: Turn 1 of your face-down Prize cards face up. If it's a Fire Energy card, this attack does 50 more damage. (That Prize card remains face up for the rest of the game.)

attacks.name: Fireball Circus
attacks.text: Discard any number of Fire Energy cards from your hand. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It's apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

data.name: Zapdos ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Synchronized Lift
abilities.text: As long as you have Articuno ex and Moltres ex in play, the Retreat Cost for Zapdos ex is 0.

attacks.name: Thunder Gift
attacks.text: You may move a Lightning Energy card attached to Zapdos ex to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lightning Wing
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

data.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Dragon Guard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to your Dragon Pokémon. (Existing effects are not removed.)

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Magnetic Circuit
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Zap Cannon
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Zap Cannon during your next turn.

data.flavorText: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokémon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin, while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.

data.name: Togetic

attacks.name: Chase Up
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage done to Togetic during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon (before they affect the damage).

data.name: Xatu

abilities.name: Psychic Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if Xatu is on your Bench, you may choose 1 Special Condition from 1 of your Active Pokémon and remove that Special Condition. Then, 1 of the Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition that you chose.

attacks.name: Energy Singe
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Steady Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.

data.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Hail Blizzard during your next turn.

data.name: Dark Magneton
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Darkness type.

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If your opponent has at least 2 Pokémon in play, move a basic Energy card from the Defending Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Cinderace V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Field Runner
abilities.text: If a Stadium is in play, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Nidoran ♀

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: While it does not prefer to fight, even one drop of the poison it secretes from its barbs can be fatal.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath

data.name: M Glalie-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cryo Mouth
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 10 or more damage counters on it, this attack does 150 more damage.

data.name: Tepig

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They will cooperate to steal eggs from the nests of bird Pokémon, but fights break out to determine which one gets to eat the eggs.

attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

data.name: Unown [J]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Join]
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have Unown [J], Unown [O], Unown [I], and Unown Dragon on your Bench, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

attacks.name: Freeze Lock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards from his or her hand to his or her Active Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost. Damage is calculated using the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost after applying effects to the Retreat Cost.

data.name: Binacle

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

data.name: Walrein

abilities.name: Gather Ice

attacks.name: Cold Crush
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Walrein and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It shatters ice with its big tusks. Its thick blubber repels not only the cold, but also enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Budew by your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon.

abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Roselia from your hand onto Budew (this counts as evolving Budew) and remove all damage counters from Budew.

attacks.name: Buddy-buddy

data.flavorText: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.

data.flavorText: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

data.name: Gyarados

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Present

data.flavorText: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has the habit of sharing food with people lost in mountains.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has soft, fine hair. When angered, it increases in size and has been known to charge those it considers a threat.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Strange Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Sticky Nectar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and, until the end of your next turn, as long as Gloom is your Active Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat, and if the effect of an attack, Pokémon Power, or Trainer card would change that player's Active Pokémon, that part of the effect does nothing. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 6 damage counters on Weezing.

data.name: Slowbro

abilities.name: Strange Behavior
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon to Slowbro as long as you don't Knock Out Slowbro. This power can't be used if Slowbro is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Butterfree equal to half the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance) (rounded up to the nearest 10).

abilities.name: Regi Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Discard 2 cards from your hand and choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon that isn't an Evolved Pokémon. Then, your opponent switches that Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Regice is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: If Regice was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Fearow.

attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Granbull. Then, Granbull does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.

data.name: Unown [A]
rules: You may have up to 4 Basic Pokémon cards in your deck with Unown in their names.

abilities.name: [Anger]
abilities.text: Whenever 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name uses its Hidden Power attack, that attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on Unown [A]. If you have more than 1 Unown [A] in play, use only 1 [Anger] for each attack.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Zamazenta

abilities.name: Sturdy Shield
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

data.name: Cacturne

attacks.name: Spike Wound
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: You may discard a Grass or Darkness Energy attached to Cacturne. If you discard a Grass Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If you discard a Darkness Energy, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

data.name: Altaria

abilities.name: Fight Song
abilities.text: Your Dragon Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: After your attack, you may switch Ditto with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Frillish
data.flavorText: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

abilities.name: Psymimic
abilities.text: Once during your turn, instead of Alakazam's normal attack, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks. Alakazam copies that attack including its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Alakazam's type is still Psychic.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Syncroblast
attacks.text: If Alakazam and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 80.

data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

data.name: Minun

data.name: Moltres & Zapdos & Articuno-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sky Legends-GX
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fire, Water, and Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 110 damage to 3 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Magnetic Reversal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nosepass is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Nosepass is affected by a Special Condition.
